meanings.definition: A ship's officer in charge of equipment and the crew.
meanings.sent1: The bosun oversaw the crew and made sure the equipment was ready.
meanings.sent2: The bosun's job is to manage the ship's gear and the sailors.
meanings.sent3: The crew joked that the bosun had eyes in the back of his head to watch everything.
meanings.sent4: The bosun steered the ship of life, guiding the crew through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The bosun's role was crucial, like the conductor of a symphony ensuring harmony.

meanings.definition: To work as a bosun on a ship.
meanings.sent1: He decided to bosun on the ship to learn more about sailing.
meanings.sent2: She will bosun on the vessel to gain experience at sea.
meanings.sent3: The friends teased him, saying he would bosun his way into becoming captain.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to bosun her way to understanding the intricacies of maritime life.
meanings.sent5: Bosuning on the ship was like embarking on a grand adventure on the high seas.
